required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Youth Epilepsy and Successful Self-Management Intervention
clinical_study.official_title: Youth Epilepsy and Successful Self-Management Intervention

brief_summary.textblock: This study is designed as a pilot test of the YESS! web-based intervention for adolescents with epilepsy. One hundred twenty participants will be given access to the intervention for a period of eight weeks. The investigators are testing the feasibility and acceptability of the the study procedures, measures and of the intervention itself. The study also evaluats the potential for impact on the users.

detailed_description.textblock:
YESS! is a web-based self management program developed to enhance the motivation and skills of youth with epilepsy.
This clinical trial uses a pre-test, post-test design where all consenting participants are given access to the intervention.

primary_outcome.measure: Feasibility of recruiting and enrollment procedures and
primary_outcome.time_frame: 8 weeks after getting access to the web intervention
primary_outcome.description: Measure the extent to which the recruitment and enrollment procedures meet the study aims in terms of number of participants log in to the intervention

primary_outcome.time_frame: 8 weeks after getting access to the web intervention
primary_outcome.description: and the extent to which users (study subjects) find the intervention easy to use, enjoyable to use, useful, engaging. Acceptability is a multifaceted and complex concept. As such it it is best examined as a system of interacting attributes.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 8 weeks after getting access to the web intervention and 8 weeks after that.
secondary_outcome.description: measures of overall well-being (EPOCH wellbeing meausre)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 8 weeks after getting access to the web intervention and 8 weeks after that.
secondary_outcome.description: measure quality of life in epilepsy (QoLiE-10)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 8 weeks after getting access to the web intervention and 8 weeks after that.
secondary_outcome.description: measure the frequency of self management behaviors (taking medications, making clinic appointments, speaking with doctor/nurse/teacher) using a measure developed for this study

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 8 weeks after getting access to the web intervention and 8 weeks after that.
secondary_outcome.description: measure the motivations (autonomous and extrinsic reasons for engaging in self management) using an adapted version of a standardized measure of motivation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age as above
- Epilepsy diagnosed by a physician
- Currently taking anti-seizure medications or use device
- Ability to understand and respond to questions about health and epilepsy
- Ability to utilize an internet based intervention website
Exclusion Criteria:

patient_data.ipd_description: YESS! is a member of the Managing Epilepsy Well (MEW) and the associated shared database of deidentified participant records
